title: How to Properly Link Apple Calendars to Thunderbird
content:
Hello. Apparently the TbSync extension no longer supports CalDav calendars since its now native in TB. I have tried to follow the directions below but it fails to authorize TB. In step 8, which password (apple account or app specific) as its not clear which one to use?

1. Generate an app specific password by logging into your apple account and generate an new password for TB. 2. Open TB 3. Create a new calendar 4. Choose :On the Network" 5. Select "CalDAV" (does not appear in TB)? 6. Enter a username (the apple id in xxx@xxx.xxx format) 7. Enter a URL for the calendar ( https://caldav.icloud.com/test@gmail.com/calendars/calendar1/ ) 8. Enter the password for https://caldav.icloud.com/test@gmail.com/calendars/calendar1/

Any help here would be greatly appreciated. Thanks.
creator: skypilot65

title: Can't configure New Release 139_0_2 with Classic View from Release 128.11
content:
My desktop computer died, so I needed to copy all my data files from backup (which worked fine) and then install all the apps that I regularly run on my laptop. When I installed Thunderbird, I got the latest Release 139.02. It behaves very differently from what I think is called the "Classic View" that was running on my Desktop. I REALLY hate it, but can't figure out how to set the Thunderbird parameters to do that. My problems include:

-- Overview of Thunderbird "Views". I can't find any documentation that explains [a] the various viewing options that Thunderbird offers and [b] EXACTLY how to set them.

-- Release Notes. I haven't found any release notes to explain when/why a major change to view was done.

-- Periodically, even for same release, Thunderbird CHANGES my parameter settings. Most annoying is changing the General Message-List settings to "Show Only Display Names For People in My Address Book". I live in a retirement community where many husbands & wives share the same Email address. With this setting, Thunderbird shows the name associate with the first message I received from this Email address. So the heading doesn't show which person actually sent it (although I can make a good guess when Thunderbird is telling me it came from a dead person. [g]

Is there ANY way I can get Release 139.0.2 to display messages the way I've been seeing them for at least 10 years? I REALLY need help. (If I can't get Thunderbird to behave the way I want, seem like I might as well switch to reading/writing messages directly from Google Gmail web site. It's equally lacking in documentation, but I suppose that eventually I could figure it out.)

Thanks in advance for any help anybody can offer.GMail, I'd seriously consider switch to using Gmail directly without Thunderbird.)
creator: MandyWh

title: Local Email Content - Headers available, but no Content
content:
Recently I noticed that in ALL of my Local Folders, I can no longer see any of the content. The headers show like normal, but I cannot open / read the content (presumably contained therein).

I have tried repairing individual folders, but nothing changes.

I have tried eliminating the .msf file, but nothing changes. A new .msf file is created, but the content is still not visible.

If I try and reply to a local email, the email is empty with the exception of the subject. Even though it shows the sender of the email (i.e. From), neither the email address nor the email content is copied into the reply.

I am slowly starting to worry that the individual files storing the email content are corrupt, but if I open the content file (i.e. non-.msf file) with Word, I get what I presume is the first / oldest email, but nothing more (even though the files are many MB large).

Is it significant that I have both "Local Folders" and "Local Folders.sbd" (as folders)? The content within them appears to be similar if not identical.

My email is stored on a NAS which I can access from any computer on my network (presuming I have set up Thunderbird appropriately); can this contribute to the issue?

Any other ideas which might lead to such an annoying issue? I really don't want to have lost all my emails for the past 20+ years.

Thanks in advance for any suggestions you make.
creator: gregory.drew

title: Thunderbird blijft dezelfde berichten als spam markeren. 2 PC's de ene accepteert de geen spam markering, de andere zet de als geen spam gemarkeerde mail binnen een paar seconden terug als spam?!
content:
Ik heb twee PC's met Thunderbird.

Beide hetzelfde (MAPI) geconfigureerd, beide PC's werken onder Windows 11 (Nederlands) en Thunderbird met de laatste updates. De adresboeken en berichtenfilters worden gesynchroniseerd dus die zijn ook hetzelfde.

En toch... Als ik op één PC (A) Thunderbird opstart staat de spambox vol met berichten die vervolgens ik allemaal als "geen spam" (SHIFT+J) markeer. Thunderbird zet ze dan terug in postvak in om ze vervolgens binnen een paar seconden weer als spam weg te zetten.

Op de andere PC (B) heb ik geen problemen, als ik dezelfde berichten daar als "geen spam" (SHIFT+J) markeer blijven ze gewoon in postvak in staan. Totdat ik op PC (A) Thunderbird opstart en... binnen een paar seconden staat de spambox vol met die berichten die geen spam zijn! Ik heb de berichtenfilters op de Thunderbird met problemen al aangepast van SpamAssassin naar SpamPal, de spam-trainingsgegevens opnieuw geïnitialiseerd, alle adresboeken (gelijk op beide PC's/Thunderbirds) opnieuw aangevinkt.

Maar niets helpt de gewenste berichten worden nog altijd binnen een paar seconden als spam gemarkeerd.

Aan de mailprovider kan het niet liggen. ik gebruik SMTP dus de mail 'blijft' op de server van mijn provider staan en op PC (B) heb ik nergens last van totdat ik op PC (B) Thunderbird opstart.

Heeft iemand een suggestie?
creator: Software204

title: Scanner won't recognize Thunderbird
content: I had to reinstall Thunderbird after getting an update/error message. After reinstalling it, my ScanSnap scanner won't send to my email anymore. I have reset all my settings to what they should be but it still won't scan to my email. The error message I get is "Either there is no default mail client or the current mail client cannot fulfill the messaging request. Please run Microsoft Outlook and set it as the default mail client." I have Thunderbird set as my mail client right now.
creator: office873
